data.title: Cannot locate type: RocketInfo
data.body:
Hello,

I got this error: "Failed to load rules for shellmap with error Cannot locate type: RocketInfo".

I'm not sure what causes this nor what fixes this. What is going on?

For relevant information, here is what exceptions found: 

3000 Mod at Version 1
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34014
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Cannot locate type: RocketInfo
   at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.<.cctor>b__13(String s)
   at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateObject[T](String className, Dictionary`2 args)
   at OpenRA.ObjectCreator.CreateObject[T](String className)
   at OpenRA.Game.CreateObject[T](String name)
   at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo.LoadProjectile(MiniYaml yaml)
   at OpenRA.FieldLoader.Load(Object self, MiniYaml my)
   at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo..ctor(String name, MiniYaml content)
   at OpenRA.RulesetCache.<LoadMapRules>b__1(MiniYamlNode k, Dictionary`2 _)
   at OpenRA.RulesetCache.<>c__DisplayClass15`1.<LoadYamlRules>b__10(MiniYamlNode wkv, Dictionary`2 wyy)
   at OpenRA.RulesetCache.<>c__DisplayClass15`1.<LoadYamlRules>b__14(MiniYamlNode kv)
   at OpenRA.Exts.ToDictionaryWithConflictLog[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable`1 source, Func`2 keySelector, Func`2 elementSelector, String debugName, Func`2 logKey, Func`2 logValue)
   at OpenRA.RulesetCache.LoadYamlRules[T](Dictionary`2 itemCache, String[] files, List`1 nodes, Func`3 f)
   at OpenRA.RulesetCache.LoadMapRules(Map map)
   at OpenRA.RulesetCache.LoadDefaultRules()
   at OpenRA.ModData.<.ctor>b__2()
   at System.Lazy`1.CreateValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.LazyInitValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.get_Value()
   at OpenRA.ModData.get_DefaultRules()
   at OpenRA.Map.<PostInit>b__16()
   at System.Lazy`1.CreateValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.LazyInitValue()
   at System.Lazy`1.get_Value()
   at OpenRA.Map.PreloadRules()
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)

data.title: added mission 5 nod
data.body:
And here is the next mission.

There is a lot of action going on and maybe a bit to tough, so happy testing.

data.title: Negating double inherited traits does not work
data.body:
If a trait is on the default (`^Helicopter` e.g.) and on the actor (`TRAN`) then simply negating it (with `-`) won't work. Tested with `LeavesHusk` on the TD `TRAN` (`LeavesHusk` is on `TRAN` but not on the default. Adding it to default also breaks the custom removal on a map).
Also noticeable with `TRAN` in #8048 and `Selectable`. [Another example.](https://gist.github.com/abcdefg30/0e6a3f33e099f5e0efd2)

Sorry if I'm too confusing. ([Here](https://gist.github.com/abcdefg30/bb8959d4c9b9a7640a50) is my IRC spam regarding this.)

data.title: Add funpark01 - Take #3
data.body:
Next try after #5320 and #6792.

Three things I need a decision on:
- [x] The map still contains unused/empty areas. What about having trees/civilians/builidngs/dinos there?
- [x] https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8085#discussion_r29555610
- [x] Do we really want the dinos to walk this (ugly) way?

data.title: Actors will lose targets and AI won't follow indefinitely
data.body:
In issue #7567, actors would keep chasing the enemy even if it moved under the shroud. The target-line was also visible making it very easy to track the target. I changed the FlyAttack, HeliAttack and MoveAdjacent activity to check if the target moved under shroud, if so, the attack activity is cancelled and a regular move is issued to the last known location.

Closes #7567.
Closes #7584.
Closes #7498.

This supersedes #7654. Changes to that pr are:
1. Uses `HiddenUnderFog` instead of `FrozenUnderFog`.
2. Adds a switch for `HeliAttack` and `FlyAttack` to ignore the behaviour, and makes it available to the Lua API.

data.title: Separate downloaded files from tracked ones
data.body:
This change puts all downloaded files in a separate directory, so that tracked files don't get cached anymore.

Side effects are that building Windows installers on Linux works again, the build scripts produce less distracting output, and [travis now uses caching](http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/caching), too.

data.title: Moved configure native dependencies
data.body: Fixup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8076.

data.title: graphical indicator on players that dont meet the requirements to "ready up"
data.body:
at the time (when im writing this idea down) ... we currently cant access openra-ressource center , because of technical issues ... so ... this is quite a pain for "ingame" admins ... loading maps which cant get installed by players (if they didnt download them before the server-issue) ... this should show up "immediately" ... so the admin is informed about the players status about the requirements...

---

administrator [or the whole lobby] should see if a player does not meet the requirements to ready up ... the reason being , for simple just not having the map (so he still has to click on the install button) or being unable to download a map cause ... unknown , broken ... ressource center not available etc. 

this way we could track faster down people that are "afk" ... or just dont fullfill the requirements right now ( theres a difference which often comes out when all players are finally ready , except one ... )

for more fancy stuff (i know this was allready a idea in the past)  , the same graphical indicator could be replaced by a different one ... showing up when the player (or administrator) doesnt have any activity in the OpenRA window for about 1-3 minutes (as desired) aka ... being "afk" ... 
this way , players wouldnt wait in a lobby for a administrator to show up ... they just change the server immidiatly ... cause sometimes theres admins just sitting in a lobby doing nothing 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/12842470-graphical-indicator-on-players-that-dont-meet-the-requirements-to-ready-up?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.body:

- Removed the `NOHQ` hack from `gdi03`
- Removed since #6964 redundant `MustBeDestroyed:` trait from `^CivInfantry` in `soviet01`

data.title: Fix the Windows Make script
data.body:
The last changes to it appear to have introduced some less than desirable behavior regarding the `thirdparty\windows\` directory.
- Removing the directory on `make clean` will complain the it isn't empty and wants confirmation from the user whether to proceed
- Running a second `make clean` will error because the same directory cannot be found for removal

data.title: Fixed the trait documentation
data.body: The `d2k` mod does not depend on all mod DLLs anymore. That assumption was a hack anyway. Same as the `modchooser` being the only invisible helper mod. This fixes the https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits documentation not showing voxel rendering traits which is not helpful when trying to explain things at www.ppmforums.com. I also decided to separate the traits by namespaces to structure the file and so modders know which DLL they need for which feature.

data.title: Improved AppVeyor build cache
data.body: Some simple fixes to speed up the build.

data.title: Configure native dependencies from the makefile.
data.body: Followup fixes to #7953.

data.title: TakeCover/FraidyCat sequence modifications overridden by WithInfantryBody
data.body:
If a sequence-modifying infantry render trait is defined on a specific actor, it overrides any sequence modifications done by traits inherited from the ^Infantry default.

Example: On current bleed, TD infantry doesn't go prone visually because TakeCover is inherited from default, while WithInfantryBody is usually defined on the individual infantry actor (because of idle sequences and so on).

This issue blocks moving TakeCover to infantry default in other mods, as it reliably breaks the visual prone sequence modifier (rest of TakeCover trait works fine).

data.title: Cleaned up infantry rules (part 1)
data.body:
This is a first step to reduce the large amount of (often unnecessary) duplication in yaml rules as well as a sort-of a prerequisite for #8012 (would reduce the required yaml changes in that PR greatly).

TS:
- Introduces a `^Viceroid` default to TS, to cut down removals/duplications
- Sets default `Bounds` on infantry default to reduce duplication, fixes position
- Moves `TakeCover` definitions to infantry default to cut down yaml lines

D2k:
- Sets default `Bounds` on infantry default to reduce duplication, fixes position
- Removes `TakeCover` properties from individual infantry types to reduce duplication
- Adds prone sequences for engineer and medic/thumper.

TD:
- Sets default `Bounds` on infantry default to reduce duplication
- Adds `TakeCover` trait to individual infantry to work around issue that prone anims don't show

RA:
- Sets default `Bounds` on infantry default to reduce duplication
- Moves `TakeCover` properties to infantry default to reduce duplication

data.title: Remove plumbing for trait unit tests.
data.body: Split from #7565.  See that issue for all the previous discussion about this.

data.title: Fix or remove Appveyor CI
data.body: It is extremely slow, and fails now almost all of the time for reasons unrelated to the pr being tested (either timing out during checkout, or failing to fetch packages from nuget).  This has gone from amusing, through ridiculous, and now sits in the completely unacceptable basket.

data.title: SpawnActorPower no longer forces removal of the spawned actor.
Correct terminology and add readonly modifiers in SpriteEffect.
Remove DeathType from DamageWarhead
data.body:
Step 2 toward fixing #7997 and my personal goal - making the `Armor` trait upgradable.

I made the logic changes and fixed RA so it works. I will add an upgrade rule to remove the redundant `DeathType` from YAML and will do the rest of the mods once the brunt of the bikeshedding over naming and the likes is over.

Closes #7997 (or maybe the next one will close it?).
Enables further warhead cleanups (creating `IWarhead`, moving `DamageWarhead` (and probably `Warhead`) to `Mods.Common`).

data.title: Add the new map editor.
data.body: A revamp of #4496.

data.title: Remote infantry crushing
data.body:
Notice how the engineer passes trough the topmost tiberium tile and dies when the harvester drives on the same tile later. Yes and this affects commandoes too. They can be crushed long after they have entered a building by driving a vehicle over the tile they entered from thus saving said building. No stealth tanks around because spectators see them and it is only 5 mins into the game:
![crush](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9487531/7403219/37e539d4-eedc-11e4-8dd6-ad03778173a7.gif)
I just wanted to put this gif here thats all :P

data.title: Clients can crash server by tampering with preferred color
data.body:
- Intercept other players preferred color any way you like
- Put it to your settings.yaml
- Join lobby with that player
- Click on empty slot (change your slot), your color will become your preferred color (it's now two players with the same color in lobby)

After this if new client will try to connect to the server it will connect and then immediately disconnect.
If admin will try to add new bots server will crash with exception:


data.title: Added option to replace disconnected clients with bots
data.body:
PR for [issue #3001](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3001): replacing disconnected clients with bots.

**Logic:**

Server drops player and send command "ActivateBot"
Game admin activates bot, notification in chat about this showed for everybody

**Detailed:**

(Option is enabled)
1. A player got dropped while a game is in progress.
2. Server doesn't send "player quit" packet (0xBF).
3. But it sends "Disconnected" instant message as usually - clients show "player disconnected" message.
4. Just after that server sends "ActivateBot" instant message.
- All clients (including admin) change their configuration so disconnected client is treated in the same way like it was a bot activated on the admin on start.
- It doesn't meter if dropped client had or had not sent packages for recent frames - clients will not check for them after this point (also look at explanation of third commit lower).
- All clients show "bot activated for <player name>" message
- Admin activates bot

Currently nothing will show that a player was real client and then was replaced by a bot except server chat message. Statistics will include combined player and bot progress after game end.

Please check spelling, especially for strings, variable names, code style, caveats.

I introduced:
"ActivateBot" command from server to clients
"Autopilot" string parameter in GlobalSettings which is a bot name if feature is enabled, null otherwise
"autopilot <bot name>" command from the admin to the lobby to enable option
"disable_autopilot" to disable

Please check implementation of the options gui. Do you have any cautions, will it work with specific maps (like scripted), foresights of bugs while player interact with the option in the lobby?

**Commits explanations (also look at the diffs and messages):**

Commit [1 of 4](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/91491277ba9c3c21a0cb1a9b1d2bee18e2e5f00d):
- I didn't found any pattern for entries order for game options fields in lobby yaml, so I reordered them to follow left to right, line after line. That helped me in future changes.
- Some source and resource files had had execute bit on. It doesn't mean anything on windows, but that doesn't look pretty under *nix, so fixed some. On *nix you can check for that with `find -executable -type f` or `find -executable -type f -not -name '\*.sh' -not -path './.git/\*' -not -path './configure'` or auto fix with `find -executable -type f -name '\*.cs' | xargs chmod a-x` 

Commit [2 of 4](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/626493676dbc47c272d56055d895e78c5b6f1b42):
- Added Session.Admin (LobbyInfo.Admin) as shortcut to `Clients.FirstOrDefault(c => c.IsAdmin)` to remove a small repetition.
- In OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs:DropClient() moved toDrop.Socket.Disconnect(false) at the beginning of the function ([#L525](https://github.com/mtarranger/OpenRA/blob/626493676dbc47c272d56055d895e78c5b6f1b42/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L525)). As far as I can see it doesn't break anything, but this removes the feeling that if somehow processing will become multi-threaded, disconnecting client will have a possibility to change something after server prepared to disconnect him and actual disconnect.
- Mono doesn't respect HOME environment variable, and I didn't want to use Support directory. So I added OPENRASUPPORTDIR environment variable, which is path to already existing directory where logs, settings and other should be saved. Where should I write its description? Additionally there should be a command line option for this in future.

Commit [3 of 4 (network code)](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/20e467ecb35a3f2d08964d4cb949350f4cf57785):
- In order to set up real client info like it is a bot client, client id should be removed from FrameData.clientQuitTimes ([#L35](https://github.com/mtarranger/OpenRA/blob/20e467ecb35a3f2d08964d4cb949350f4cf57785/OpenRA.Game/Network/FrameData.cs#L35)). This also excludes the client from IsReadyForNextFrame checks but doesn't affect FrameData.framePackets which holds any available order packets for disconnected client. The logic I chose implies that FrameData.clientQuitTimes is just optimization for checks who's playing and not for journaling purposes and can be freely modified.

Commit [4 of 4 (gui code)](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/09bfb29ef33f15131fcb930b5133887c86029009):
Nothing special.

The projects code is very nice but it lacks comments (and self descriptive names doesn't always work).

IMHO network code and logic is a bit messy and requires some rewriting. The servers code becomes entangled.

Widgets logic code (at least in OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/) also a bit messy and a bit self repetitive.

**Conceptual questions:**
- Should autopilot be in map options? (Currently a map cannot set autopilot option)
- Can the removal of disconnected client id from FrameData.clientQuitTimes (described above in third commit) interfere with replay possibility? As it seems, replay will log "Disconnected", "ActivateBot" messages and will change FrameData.clientQuitTimes during replay as it happened during the game.
- Player name remain unchanged after the replacement (only chat message notes about replacement). I can change that if you want. In my understanding there are forces on the map that have names, and they are ruled by its command. I'd suggest that when a bot activated for a player bot type written in parenthesis after the player name, and when a bot added in the lobby it added with name "Bot".
- Also what should be BotControllerClientIndex if game doesn't have admins (dedicated, dropped)? I used `BotControllerClientIndex = admin == null ? 0 : admin.Index` ([#L90](https://github.com/mtarranger/OpenRA/blob/20e467ecb35a3f2d08964d4cb949350f4cf57785/OpenRA.Game/Network/UnitOrders.cs#L90)). Should it be -1 or other special?

**Random remarks** (that arose during the work):
- There are a couple of places where FirstOrDefault is used without further check if the result is null. Like in OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs:LobbyLogic.LobbyLogic(), variable botController ([#L193](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs#L193), [#L576](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs#L576), changed from `LobbyInfo.Clients.FirstOrDefault(c => c.IsAdmin)` to `LobbyInfo.Admin` in my commits but it's the same) or in LobbyUtils.cs ([#L55](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyUtils.cs#L55))
- All "Send*" and "Dispatch*" in OpenRA.Game/Server/[Server.cs](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/626493676dbc47c272d56055d895e78c5b6f1b42/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L409) should be rethinked and rewritten.
- IsHost on clients and IsAdmin on server are ambiguous. At first thought IsHost should be true if client hosting a game, not dedicated server, and any one in the lobby can be selected as IsAdmin. Now they are used as the same thing.
- I would suggest to add in OpenRA.Game/Network/[FrameData.cs](https://github.com/mtarranger/OpenRA/blob/20e467ecb35a3f2d08964d4cb949350f4cf57785/OpenRA.Game/Network/FrameData.cs#L29),
  
  ```
  AddClient(clientId)
  {
  clientQuitTimes.Add(clientId, 0x7FFFFFFF)
  }
  ```
  
  as a way to tell FrameData that the clients packages is required for a next frame, and in OpenRA.Game/Network/[OrderManager.cs](https://github.com/mtarranger/OpenRA/blob/20e467ecb35a3f2d08964d4cb949350f4cf57785/OpenRA.Game/Network/OrderManager.cs#L85),
  
  ```
  WaitForClient(client)
  {
  frameData.AddClient(clientId)
  }
  ```
  
  for same reason, and remove `DispatchOrdersToClient(c, d.PlayerIndex, 0x7FFFFFFF, new byte[] { 0xBF });` from server (OpenRA.Game/Server/[Server.cs#L677](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Game/Server/Server.cs#L677)).
  
  But this should be a part of network code rewrite.
  
  WaitForClient can probably be called from one of GameStarted. Additionaly notifications (using interfaces) can be used for client disconnect/replacement.
- It's better to separate message strings from code (like in OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/[LobbyLogic.cs](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs#L414)), although I understand it should be done after internationalization will be implemented.
- Usage and meaning of Actor, IActor and others *Actor* in the project is a bit confusing, at least without comments (too many too different types of "actors").
- Order.PauseGame() (OpenRA.Game/Network/[Order.cs, #L150](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Game/Network/Order.cs#L150)) and PlayerCommands.InvokeCommand() (OpenRA.Mods.Common/Commands/[PlayerCommands.cs, #L43](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Commands/PlayerCommands.cs#L43)) contains same code `new Order("PauseGame", null, false) ...`. What's the right location? Also `new Order("Surrender", ...` in 2 places (OpenRA.Mods.Common/Commands/[PlayerCommands.cs, #L49](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Commands/PlayerCommands.cs#L49), OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/[IngameMenuLogic.cs, #L75](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Ingame/IngameMenuLogic.cs#L75))
- Flag numbers from network communication (like `0xBF`) can be put to constants with meaningful names (like FrameData.Markers.LastSeen or anything)
- OpenRA.Order.Deserialize() (OpenRA.Game/Network/[Order.cs, #L94](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Game/Network/Order.cs#L94)) and OpenRA.Server.ServerOrder.Deserialize() (OpenRA.Game/Server/[ServerOrder.cs, #L38](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Game/Server/ServerOrder.cs#L38)) contains same code. Maybe it's better to move read/write code to something like OrderFormat or change meaning of current names.
- Maybe strings in clients-server communication from OpenRA.Mods.Common ("TeamChat", "HandshakeRequest", "SyncInfo", ...) should be constants with special byte value (0x01 0x01, 0x01 0x02, ...)? Or at least string constants with current values and corresponding names to avoid typing mistakes?
- As it seems, meaning of Requires<T> (OpenRA.Game/Traits/TraitsInterfaces.cs) isn't documented anywhere, however it's usefull feature for mods.
- I think trait *.cs files in some directories can be placed more structured. Trait interfaces inside TraitsInterfaces.cs also (at least more sorted).
- Ending of OpenRA.Game/[Sync.cs](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/b4fa704fbd61a8d66641f730adff5c9a43bdd498/OpenRA.Game/Sync.cs#L167) really needs comments. It looks like after the first successful fn execution inUnsyncedCode will never be false again.
- ./configure and make functionality is confusing. Typically configure creates Makefile configured to use tools available on platform and build with options set by configure. There is Makefile out of the box but compilation will fail because there is no Eluant.dll.config which is created by configure. `make` should fail with sensible message about configure wasn't executed or it should be changed to fulfill its task when called.
  I suggest either to remove configure at all and move its functionality to Makefile or rewrite configure so it will:
  - Detect platform libraries
  - Detect third-party libraries download method (is there nuget available or curl/wget should be used to download from `https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/$packageName/$packageVersion`. I did it with curl)
  - Write configs, scripts and Makefile
- I suggest OPENRAMODSDIR environment variable and command line option to point to custom mods directory location.
- Also at least short --help, -h and /? command line option would be nice.
